Package jetbrains.mps.ide.findusages.model.scopes

Class GlobalScope

  • java.lang.Object
    • jetbrains.mps.smodel.BaseScope
      • jetbrains.mps.ide.findusages.model.scopes.FindUsagesScope
        • jetbrains.mps.ide.findusages.model.scopes.GlobalScope
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    jetbrains.mps.ide.findusages.IExternalizeable, org.jetbrains.mps.openapi.module.SearchScope
    public class GlobalScope
extends jetbrains.mps.ide.findusages.model.scopes.FindUsagesScope
    Scope that includes both project and deployed modules. There's no such thing as ultimate 'global' scope as it doesn't make sense. If there are few projects open, then each has a 'global' scope that gives access to any module available in the given project, either source modules being edited or deployed modules project runs with.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GlobalScope

        @Deprecated
public GlobalScope()
        Deprecated.
        use GlobalScope(Project) instead. There are no more uses in MPS, please don't introduce any new one. However, we have to keep this code fore fe releases as there's 'execute finders' expression, which defaults to use of this scope when none is specified. Though we warn about unspecified scope now, it's unlikely to trigger prompt fixes in our clients. We need to change generator to use something more reasonable than new GS(), but I failed to come up with an idea what would it be (ProjectManager.allOpenProjects.collect(p->p.repo)?).

      • GlobalScope

        public GlobalScope​(jetbrains.mps.project.Project mpsProject)

                   jetbrains.mps.project.Project project)
